rooms.description: Traditional Kerala-style entrance hall with minimalistic design and open space.
Open-plan living area merging with the kitchen. Features floor-to-ceiling windows on west-facing wall to maximize natural light while considering Vastu.
Integrated open-plan kitchen design that flows seamlessly into the living area; includes traditional Kerala motifs and functional cabinetry.
Dedicated dining space adjacent to the living area with subtle partitions following Vastu guidelines for positive energy flow.
Spacious master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom; positioned on a less dominant side of the bungalow as per traditional Kerala planning to maintain privacy and tranquility.
Three additional bedrooms arranged around the core living spaces for family use, ensuring adequate natural light and ventilation in line with Vastu principles.
Common bathroom shared by secondary bedrooms; designed to be compact yet functional within budget constraints.

openings.description: Large entry door with traditional Kerala woodwork and glass accents, ensuring a warm welcome while maintaining energy flow.
Floor-to-ceiling west-facing window for optimal natural light; includes privacy screening as per budget considerations.
Smaller east-facing windows to provide morning light and maintain energy balance.

additional_features.vastu_corrections: The layout ensures that the kitchen is not directly in line with the main entrance. Bedrooms are oriented away from the front door for privacy. Windows on west wall help balance negative energies.
additional_features.budget_considerations: Use of locally available materials and simplified traditional motifs to keep costs low.
